profile.title: Profile
profile.connectToView: Connect a wallet to view your profile.
profile.aboutDesc: Heads or Tails — a PvP game on the Axiome blockchain. Place a bet, someone else accepts it — and the blockchain fairly determines the winner. No manipulations, no server-side control.
profile.aboutDescShort: A PvP game on the Axiome blockchain. Place a bet, someone else accepts it — and the blockchain fairly determines the winner. No manipulations, no server-side control.
profile.winnerExplanation: Imagine: one player puts a coin under a cup — only they know if it's heads or tails. They photograph the cup from above and send the photo. The second player makes their guess. The first lifts the cup — the result is visible. The first player can't swap the coin (the photo is already recorded), and the second couldn't peek (the coin was hidden). In our game, instead of a photo we use a mathematical "fingerprint" recorded on the blockchain.
profile.fairnessStep1Desc: You only specify the amount. The server generates a random side (heads/tails) and a secret number using cryptographic randomness. A "digital fingerprint" (SHA-256 hash) is computed from these. Only the fingerprint is recorded on the blockchain — it's impossible to determine the side or secret from it.
profile.fairnessStep2Desc: Another player clicks "Accept". The server generates a random guess for them. In a single atomic transaction, the blockchain receives: the acceptor's guess + the creator's revealed side and secret.
profile.fairnessStep3Desc: The contract recomputes the fingerprint from the revealed data and compares it to the one stored at creation. If they match — the result is fair, the winner is determined. If not — the transaction is rejected. Tampering with data after bet creation is impossible.
profile.whyFair1: The fingerprint is recorded on the blockchain when the bet is created — it cannot be changed retroactively
profile.whyFair2: Both sides are generated independently using cryptographically secure randomness — predicting the result is impossible
profile.whyFair3: The smart contract mathematically verifies authenticity — if anyone tries to swap the side, the fingerprint won't match and the transaction is rejected
profile.oneLiner: Each player gets a random side independently. The first result is "sealed" on the blockchain before the second is determined. Tampering is impossible — guaranteed by math and blockchain, not by trust in us.
profile.commissionDesc: The winner receives 90% of the total pot. 10% goes as platform commission.
profile.securityDesc: All game logic runs on a smart contract. Funds are held in the contract, not on our servers. The contract cryptographically verifies every reveal through the commitment scheme. Source code is open and auditable.
profile.randomCodeComment7: Match → result is fair, winner is determined
profile.randomCodeExplanation: is a cryptographic hash function. It's impossible to reverse-engineer the original data from the fingerprint. Any change in input completely changes the output.
profile.rulesStep1Desc: Transfer COIN tokens from your wallet to the game vault.
profile.rulesStep2Desc: Choose a wager amount and create a bet. Funds are locked in the smart contract.
profile.rulesStep3Desc: Browse open bets and accept one to play. You need an equal amount.
profile.rulesStep4Desc: The winner is determined instantly when a bet is accepted. The smart contract verifies and pays out in one transaction.
profile.rulesStep5Desc: Your winnings go to the game vault. Withdraw to your wallet anytime.
profile.important1: Each bet has a 3-hour expiration. Unaccepted bets are automatically canceled and funds returned.
profile.important2: Game account activation is required to play. It authorizes the system to process your bets on the Heads or Tails contract.
profile.important3: All actions are recorded on the blockchain and can be verified in the explorer.
profile.disconnectDesc: Lock session but keep wallet data
profile.forgetWalletDesc: Remove all wallet data from this device
profile.eventsIntro: The platform regularly hosts contests and raffles with real COIN token prizes.
profile.contestsDesc: A contest is a competition between players over a set period. Play coin flips as usual — all your bets count automatically. Top performers win prizes. Metrics can vary: total turnover, number of wins, or net profit. Participation is free and automatic — just play!
profile.rafflesDesc: A raffle is a lottery among participants. Click 'Join Raffle' on the raffle page to enter. Winners are chosen randomly using a verifiable algorithm (seed is published after the draw). More participants mean a bigger prize pool!
profile.prizeFundingDesc: The prize pool is funded from the platform commission (10% of each bet). Part goes to referral payouts, part to the events treasury. Exact amounts are listed on each event page. Everything is transparent: payouts happen via smart contract and are visible on the blockchain explorer.
profile.howToParticipateDesc: Check the 'Events' section in the navigation. For contests — just play, your bets are counted automatically. For raffles — click 'Join Raffle' on the event page. Prizes are credited to your vault balance automatically after results are finalized.
profile.telegramDesc: Link your Telegram account so other players can message you.
profile.telegramNotConfigured: Telegram integration is not configured yet.

aboutSections.serverArchitecture: How it works on the server
aboutSections.depositBody: COIN is a CW20 token. You sign a CW20 Send transaction in your Axiome wallet (Keplr or built-in), sending tokens to the game contract address. The contract accepts only COIN and credits the amount to your "game balance" (vault). Confirmation typically takes 2–10 seconds.
aboutSections.withdrawBody: The contract sends COIN back to your address. Once your account is activated, the relayer signs for you (via Authz) and covers gas fees. Confirmation ~2–10 seconds.
aboutSections.betFlowBody: 1) Create: you choose the amount, the server generates a random secret (heads or tails) and stores its hash (commitment) on the blockchain via create_bet. 2) Accept: another player clicks "Accept & Flip", the server randomly picks heads/tails for them, and sends accept_and_reveal — a single atomic transaction that verifies the secret, determines the winner, and distributes the payout instantly. No delays, no extra steps.
aboutSections.timingsBody: An open bet lives for 3 hours. Accept and result — typically 2–10 seconds on-chain (single atomic transaction). Deposit/withdraw transactions — 2–10 seconds.
aboutSections.branchChangeBody: Cost — 1,000 COIN. Two transactions: withdraw from vault to wallet, then transfer to treasury. Usually 10–20 seconds. The new referrer must exist in the system and not create a cycle.
aboutSections.contractBody: CosmWasm contract coinflip-pvp-vault. Stores: balances (available, locked), bets (commitment, status), config (10% commission, min bet, timeouts). Messages: deposit, withdraw, create_bet, accept_and_reveal, cancel_bet. The chain is the single source of truth.
aboutSections.relayerBody: You grant Authz to our relayer to execute game messages on the contract on your behalf. The relayer covers gas fees. After one-time activation, create, accept, and withdraw work without repeated signatures.
aboutSections.indexerBody: The server polls Axiome blocks, extracts contract events (bet_created, bet_revealed, bet_canceled, etc.), syncs them to the DB, and broadcasts via WebSocket. The UI updates in real time.
aboutSections.step1Desc: Use Keplr or the built-in Axiome wallet. Your keys stay with you.
aboutSections.step2Desc: Click "Deposit" and sign the CW20 Send. COIN moves from wallet to contract. Confirmation ~2–10 sec.
aboutSections.step3Desc: Sign the activation once. After that, create, accept, and withdraw work without repeated signatures. Valid for 30 days.
aboutSections.step4Title: Step 4: Create or accept a bet
aboutSections.step4Desc: Create a bet (min 1 COIN) or accept someone else's. When you accept, the server picks heads/tails for you and submits a single transaction — the winner is determined instantly.
aboutSections.step5Desc: The result is determined instantly when someone accepts your bet. The smart contract verifies the creator's secret, compares sides, and pays out — all in one transaction. Winner gets 90% of the pot, 10% goes as commission.
aboutSections.step6Desc: Winnings are credited to your game balance. Withdraw to your wallet anytime.
aboutSections.contractStorage: The contract stores: balances (available — free, locked — in bets), bets with commitment and status, config (10% commission, min bet 1 COIN, open bet TTL 3 hours).
aboutSections.contractMessages: Messages: deposit (CW20 Receive), withdraw, create_bet, accept_and_reveal, cancel_bet. Accept and payout happen in a single atomic transaction — the contract verifies the commitment and distributes funds instantly.

landing.tagline: PvP Heads or Tails on Axiome Chain. Provably fair. 50/50 chance. Winner takes 90%.
landing.securityNote: Your keys stay in your browser. Fully transparent and auditable.

referral.shareText: Play Heads or Tails — PvP on Axiome Chain! Use my link:

referral.rewardStructureDesc: You earn a percentage from every game your referrals play. Rewards come from the 10% platform commission — players don't lose anything extra.
referral.exampleDesc: Player A bets 100 COIN, Player B accepts. Total pot is 200 COIN. Commission is 20 COIN (10%). Here's how it's split:
referral.rewardNote: Rewards are calculated from both players in each game. If you invited both — you earn from both sides.
referral.inviteDesc: Invite friends and earn from every game they play. Rewards come from the platform commission — players don't lose anything extra.
referral.step1: Share your referral link with friends
referral.step3: You earn a percentage from every game they play
referral.step4: Your invites' invites also earn you rewards (3 levels deep)

referral.changeBranchCycle: This change would create a circular chain
referral.rewardSourceDesc: Rewards come from the platform commission (10% of each pot). When you claim, tokens are sent from the treasury vault directly to your Axiome wallet — not to your game vault. You can then deposit to play or keep them in your wallet.

info.title: How do events work?
info.contestDesc: A contest is a competition between players over a set period. Play coin flips as usual — all your bets count automatically. Top performers win prizes. Metrics can vary: total turnover (sum of all bets), number of wins, or net profit. Participation is free and automatic — just play!
info.raffleDesc: A raffle is a lottery among participants. Click 'Join Raffle' on the raffle page to enter. Winners are chosen randomly using a verifiable algorithm (seed is published after the draw). More participants mean a bigger prize pool!
info.rulesDesc: Events are launched periodically by the CoinFlip team. Prizes are credited to your vault balance automatically after results are finalized. Keep an eye on active events — they appear in this section. Each event has a limited duration.

rules.title: How to participate
rules.contestAutoJoin: All players participate automatically — just play during the event!

jackpot.subtitle: Win big from every bet placed
jackpot.howItWorks: 1% of every bet goes into 5 jackpot pools. When a pool fills up, a random eligible player wins the entire prize! Pools reset and start filling again automatically.
jackpot.howStep1: 1% of every bet goes into 5 jackpot pools
jackpot.howStep2: When a pool fills up, a random winner is drawn
jackpot.howStep3: Prize is credited to your game balance instantly
jackpot.howStep4: Pools reset and start filling again automatically
